A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Star Wars the Last Jedi meets and exeeds the impossibly high standards set for it. With complex character development\, a fast momentum built through a string of tense fight scenes and Star Wars typical plot twists\, The Last Jedi is arguably one of the best films in the franchise. Despite this\, the film lags around the halfway point following a side plot involving Finn\, which breaks an otherwise well paced film. We also see alot more emotional depth in Kylo's character than Rae's\, who in many ways\, has taken steps back as a well built protaganist since the last film.
